ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Independent research skills and everything going along with it!
writing a thesis, editing, revising, peer criticism, independent work, advisor-advisee relations

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Prof Freidenburg is great and funding is great! 

Weaknesses: Some of the peer activities felt like busy work, and sometimes the schedule would go from 0-100 in terms of expectations.

I think the structure of the spring colloqium (2nd semester BA in my case) with just occasional check-ins and draft deadlines was actually perfect for accountability and also more hands off than fall which was appreciated

the work is frontloaded to the beginning of the semester -- meaning that it felt like a rush to produce a draft before spring break and then we had three weeks at the end where there is nothing to do. i think pushing the timeline back one week could be productive

i like the independent nature of this course, loved kealoha, and the class environment

I think the senior thesis is great and you learn a lot. I really wish the professors worked with each student on an individual level instead of giving everyone checkpoints. The checkpoints are really good for some people, but they really stressed me out, and I worked on a different timeline than most people. So I wish the checkpoints were created between the individual and the colloquium professor, especially if someone has a disability.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes-- you have to take it
If youre in the EVST major, you have to take this. And it is definitely helpful to finish your thesis, but also disorganized and superfluous at times.
